question: I have a 10 and 1/2 Yorkie Maltese. She has been a very healthy 10-11 pound dog until June 2013.  She started drinking water like crazy, losing her footing, and just didn't seem like herself.  I took her to the vets, but it wasn't til the second time that the diabetes showed up.  I think I noticed the change in her sooner than her blood! That's how close we are...She was peeing in the house.  I knew she knew better.  I could see it on her face.  She was so sad that she did it. I knew she didn't mean to. I knew she wasn't feeling right. So, the diabetes...I thought, phew! we can do this.2 weeks later...pancreaitis.  severe pain. I couldn't stand seeing it.  She's on opiates. She doesn't walk anymore, bark at the mailman, I have to carry her everywhere...How do I know when I'm being selfish?? This is just horrible. Is pancreaitis recoverable??? I cant get a straight answer from the vet.
title: Diabetes and pancreaitis sudden onset in small dog
